title: Chin Chun Motor Co., Ltd.
text:
Chin Chun Motor Co., Ltd. is a Taiwanese automobile manufacturer. It was established on 13 June 1991 in <a href="Taoyuan%20City%2C%20Taiwan">Taoyuan City, Taiwan</a>. The company is a joint venture between <a href="Volkswagen%20AG">Volkswagen AG</a> and <a href="Chinfon%20Huanyu">Chinfon Huanyu</a>, a subsidiary of <a href="Chinfon%20Group">Chinfon Group</a>. The company is part of the <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>ese <a href="Chinfon%20Group">Chinfon Group</a>.
In 1994, after signing the domestic manufacturing deal of the <a href="Volkswagen%20Transporter%20%28T4%29">Volkswagen Transporter (T4)</a> in Taiwan, the company signed to become the procuration of the <a href="Spain">Spanish</a> auto brand, <a href="SEAT">SEAT</a> in Taiwan. The company was in charge of importing <a href="SEAT%20C%C3%B3rdoba">SEAT Córdoba</a> and <a href="SEAT%20Ibiza">SEAT Ibiza</a> passenger cars. Due to slow sales, the import stopped shortly after only one year.
On 24 November 1999, Chin Chun Motor became the procuration of the <a href="South%20Korea">Korean</a> auto brand <a href="Hyundai%20Motors">Hyundai</a> and further introduced the Hyundai <a href="Hyundai%20Atos">Atos</a>、<a href="Hyundai%20Trajet">Trajet</a>、<a href="Hyundai%20Santa%20Fe">Santa Fe</a>、<a href="Hyundai%20XG350">XG</a> passenger cars and SUVs, with the <a href="Hyundai%20XG350">XG</a> being manufactured domestically in Taiwan starting from March 2001.
In 2002, the company transformed into a foundry of <a href="Hyundai%20Motors">Hyundai</a> as affiliates <a href="SYM%20Motors">Sangyang</a> became the official procuration of the brand after ending the contract with <a href="Honda">Honda</a>.
In 2007, <a href="Chinfon%20Group">Chinfon Group</a> rearranged the automobile business within the group and combined Chin Chun Motor into the larger Nanyang Motors Company in charge of <a href="SYM%20Motors">Sangyang Motors</a>. With the sales of commercial vehicles of <a href="Hyundai%20Motor%20Company">Hyundai</a> also being transferred to the Nanyang Motors Company, the operation of <a href="Chinfon%20Group">Chinfon Group</a> was ceased with the factories, equipments, and workers transferred and rented to <a href="SYM%20Motors">Sangyang</a>.
in 2009, <a href="SYM%20Motors">Sangyang</a> teamed up with <a href="Automatic%20Equipment%20Inc.%20%28AEI%29">Automatic Equipment Inc. (AEI)</a> and won the contract of 3,598 Light Military Vehicle deal by the <a href="Ministry%20of%20National%20Defense%20%28Republic%20of%20China%29">Ministry of National Defense</a> of <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>ese government and manufactured the vehicles in the Chin Chun Motor factory located in <a href="Guanyin%20District">Guanyin</a>, <a href="Taoyuan%20City">Taoyuan City</a>. The vehicles were modified licensed <a href="Jeep%20Wrangler">Jeep Wrangler JK Unlimited</a> by <a href="Automatic%20Equipment%20Inc.%20%28AEI%29">AEI</a> adapting to the Taiwan environment.
On 22 December 2010, <a href="PX%20Mart">PX Mart</a> bought the factory and remaining lands of Chin Chun Motor's <a href="Guanyin%20District">Guanyin</a>, <a href="Taoyuan%20City">Taoyuan</a> facilities with <a href="New%20Taiwan%20dollar">NTD</a> 24.6 hundred million yuan, including land of 66,000 <a href="Pyeong">Pyeong</a>, buildings of 24,600 <a href="Pyeong">Pyeong</a> and the machines and equipments.
